Premier dota cup Season 1

Premier Dota cup Season 1 Sponsored by Dota2India.com  to clash for an overall prize pool of $7,000 USD.  

  • Prize Distribution
    • $7,000 USD is spread among the teams as seen below:
      • 1st $4,000
      • 2nd $2,000
      • 3rd $1,000
  • Participants
    • 6 invited teams
    • 2 teams from closed qualifiers.
 
  • Dates:
    • 11th Dec, 2020 - 15 Jan, 2021
 
  • Group Stage
    • Dec 11th - 24th, 2020
    • Round-robin
    • Two groups of four teams each
    • All matches are Bo3
    • The top Four teams proceed to the Upper Bracket of the Playoffs.
    • The bottom Four teams proceed to the Lower Bracket of the Playoffs.
 
  • Playoffs
    • Dec 26th, 2020 - Jan 4th, 2021
    • Double-elimination bracket
    • Grand Final is Bo5
    • All matches except Grand Final are Bo3
 
  • You can follow the tournament on Instagram
  • Click HERE to watch the live stream.
  • Schedule
  • Playoffs
  •  Rule book
        PREREQUISITES
  • By entering as a team into the tournament, all players acknowledge that they fully agree to the rules and terms of the tournament.
  • All players also acknowledge they are above 18 years old and eligible legally to participate in the tournament.
  • By failing to comply with prerequisites users will get eliminated from the tournament as well as banned.
  • Organizers Events take the right to validate and confirm the details for each user before, during, and after the tournament takes place. If any irregularities are found at a player or at one or more members of the team, respective tournament organizers (“TO”) take the right to disqualify any player or the whole team from the tournament even after the tournament is finished.
  • When in doubt about anything regarding rules or if you have any questions related to the following tournament, please contact the official discord channel which has been given to you.
  QUICK RULES
  • All players must be 18 years old or older in order to compete.
  •  Games are played in 5v5 Captains Mode.
  • The tournament format depends on the event and it is specified within the event rules seen under the Tournament Overview Format section.
  • When in a tournament, if a player or all team members don’t join the match within the 10 minutes Connect game period, the match will count as an auto-loss and the opposing team will win the match or has to play with fewer players.
  Format
  • 1.   Dates: Dec 11th, 2020 - Jan 15th, 2021
  • 2.   Premier Dota cup Season 1 is divided into 2 stages:
   Group Stage  
  • Dates:  Dec 11th - 24th, 2020
  • Round Robin format with 8 Teams (6 Invited, 2 Qualified teams and 2 Groups with 4 teams in each).
  • Top four teams from each group will advance to the Winner Bracket of the Playoffs Stage,
  • Bottom four teams from each group will advance to the Lower Bracket of the Playoffs Stage.
         Playoff Stage  
  • Dates:  Dec 26th 2020 - Jan 4th, 2021
  • Double elimination format for 6 teams (4 Teams in Winner bracket and 4 Teams in Lower bracket)
  Teams & Players  
  • A team must consist of a minimum of 5 players.
  • Real nicks must be used.
  • Tags must be used.
  • Stand-ins can be used online, max 3 in tournament
  • Stand-ins must not be a member of another team in the tournament.
  • Stand-ins must use a Stand-in tag before their nicknames.
  • If stand-ins are to be used, Admins must be notified at least 12 hours before the game time.
  Players Information
  • Players must send to the tournament organizer all the necessary information about
  • The team and players at the official request of the organizer.
  Selection order
  • An automatic coin toss is used on the first map, on the second map the opposite command has the right of the first choice.
  Servers
  • The default servers are Singapore.
  • The game can be postponed for a maximum of 1 hour from the time of its official start because of the delay of the previous game.
  •  In case of the delay of a match for more than 1 hour - the teams have the right to ask to postpone the match for another day at a time convenient for them.
  • The game will be hosted by the admin at least 15 minutes before the first game is to start.
  • A representative from each team must be in contact with an admin 15 mins before the game is supposed to start (Team Captain or Manager).
  • All the players should be in the game 5 minutes before the game will start.
  Penalty points
  • 5 mins: take 30 secs delay
  • 10 mins: take 70 secs delay
  • 15mins: take 110 secs delay
  • 20 mins: take Def Lose map 1
  Disconnection, pauses & crashes
  • Pausing is not allowed during picks unless the captain disconnects.
  • If the game crashes during the picks, the game will be remade and the same picks will be picked.
  • Players have the right to pause the game if needed. Be sure to announce the pause in
  • All-chat a few seconds before if not an emergency.
  • The reason for the pause must be reasonable. Both teams must agree on resuming before resuming the game.
  • If a player disconnects, the player’s team should pause the game right away.
  • A team has the right to 10 minutes' worth of pause per map. (Per team and per map) After that, the opponent team can resume unless the admin stated otherwise.
  • If teams disconnect from the game completely and do not have any chance to connect to the game again:
  • If the advantage of one of the teams is less than 15 000 - This map should be restart
  • If the advantage of one of the teams is more than 15 000 - This team is winning on this map
Streaming and spectating
  • No streaming allowed except for streamers chosen by administrators
  • Only chosen streamers, producers, and admins will be allowed in the spectator-spots.
   Streaming will be in the following languages:
  • English
  Behavior
  • Flaming and bad-mouthing are not allowed.
  • The usage of all-chat should be used to a minimum.
  • No offensive nicknames are allowed.
  • Players should, while in-game, use their official nicks
  • Teams should, while in-game, use their official tag
  Map-set  
  • The following settings are to be used in every game:
  • Lobby password: Will also be posted on Discord when the lobby is hosted:-
  • Cheats: Off
  • Bots: Off
  • All Chat: Off
  • Version: Tournament
  • Series: BO3
  • Game mode: Captains Mode
  • Starting Team: Decided before the game
  • Punishments: None
  • Server: Singapore
  • Spectators: Tour Ticket
  • Dota TV Delay: 5 mins
  • The version to play is the current Tournament Version.
  • The mode to be played is CM.
    Rules about slots in the tournament
  • Slots in tournaments have 3 players from teams, and in case of their withdrawal from the team, they have the primary right to the slot (But any 3 players and the team have a slot on a tournament only after his 1 game in a tournament). In case of their refusal from the slot - judges decide who will get it
  • Also if the team leave from the tournament 2 days before starts tournament or after the tournament start:
  1. If reason will be disband - judges will choose penalties for them
  2. If reason will be not disband - the team will have 6 months ban in Organizers Events
  3. Judges can change penalties from point 2
    Rules about awards for matches
  • Winning awards 3 points
  • Losing rewards no points
  • In addition to the rules about Playoffs
  • What do we do if the teams have the same score at the end of the main stage:
 
  1. If two teams have the same score, then we look at the results of a personal match of these teams.
  2. If there are three teams, then we look at the result of the matches on the maps between these teams. If the result maps the same, then we look at the result of the maps for all matches of the main stage. If after that the team points are equal, tiebreaker bo1 matches.
  Penalties
  • If a team violates the rules of paragraph “Teams & Players” – Team Disqualified from the tournament and have 3 months ban on Organizers Events
  • If a team violates the rules of paragraph “Behaviour” – Team lose map/match/disqualify from the tournament or have 3 months ban on Organizers Events
  • If a team violates the rules of paragraph “Streaming and spectating” – Team or player Disqualified from the tournament and have 9 months ban on Organizers Events
  • If a team violates the rules of paragraph “Disconnects, pauses and crashes” – Team lose map/match/disqualify from the tournament or have 2 months ban on Organizers Events
Betting
  • No players, team managers, staff, or management of attending organizations may be involved in betting or gambling, associate with betters or gamblers or provide anyone any information that may assist betting or gambling, either directly or indirectly, for any of the tournament matches or the tournament in general. Any bets against your organization’s matches will result in the immediate disqualification of your organization and a minimum ban for 2 years and 6 months on all the organization’s tournaments. Other violations are penalized at the discretion of tournament administrators.
  Editing the rules
  • Any rule can be changed or added during the event by the admins.
  Game end
  • The game is over when either team’s Ancient Fortress is destroyed
  • “GG” is typed, is a confirmation of defeat
 
  • Brackets
